snippet: A federal judge questions whether an oversight council has systems in place to both gather evidence and fairly judge financial firms.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge Rosemary Collyer examines regulator's designation of insurer MetLife as 'systemically important' to financial system, status that comes with certain regulations; MetLife sued government in January 2015.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge questions whether an oversight council has systems in place to both gather evidence and fairly judge financial firms.

headline.main: MetLife Makes Its Case Against ‘Too Big to Fail’ Label
headline.print_headline: MetLife Makes Its Case Against ‘Too Big to Fail’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
